;;共和党人吉姆·乔丹在竞选美国众议院议长的第一次投票中落败，引发了人们对他赢得这一职位的前景的质疑。关于这位保守派煽动者和前总统唐纳德·特朗普的亲密盟友，您应该了解以下四件事。;
;

;直言不讳的保守派;吉姆·乔丹 (Jim Jordan) 周三第二次尝试担任美国众议院最高职位，但未能成功，因为他的共和党同僚们考虑了让这个群龙无首的众议院继续前进的后备选择。

;

;乔丹看起来他获得的票数将少于填补众议院席位所需的 217 票;议长席位空缺;，因为 13 名共和党人在唱名投票初期就投了反对票。共和党以 221 比 212 获得多数席位，这表明乔丹将再次失败。投票仍在继续。

;

;乔丹周二只获得了 200 张共和党选票。

;

;如果第二次投票失败，目前还不清楚乔丹是否会进行第三次尝试，或者他是否会清除投票后备选项的方式将增加众议院帕特里克·麦克亨利的权力，他暂时填补了议长席位。

;

;控制众议院的共和党人;无法团结;支持发言人候选人，因为其中一小派被驱逐;凯文·麦卡锡;，10 月 3 日。

;

;这可能允许国会应对中东和乌克兰的危机，并在 11 月 17 日之后为政府提供资金，届时当前资金将到期。

;

;“我们今天必须做出决定，”乔丹告诉记者。 “这两个问题都应该提出。让我们得到答案。我们已经过了两周了。美国人民应该让他们的政府正常运转。”

;

;这个想法是由共和党和民主党提出的，因为以及两位前共和党议长纽特·金里奇和约翰·博纳。

;

;共和党众议员迈克·凯利提交的一项提案将任命麦克亨利为议长，任期至 11 月 17 日或直到选定永久议长为止，这将消除关于选举的不确定性。他目前管理议会的能力。这一临时解决方案还可以为乔丹赢得更多时间，以便在那之后获得对这项工作的支持。

;

;民主党人的支持可能至关重要，他们已经明确表示他们希望乔丹退出。众议院民主党领袖哈基姆·杰弗里斯周二表示：“我们希望走一条两党共同前进的道路。这不涉及吉姆·乔丹，他是共和党极端主义的典型代表，对我们的民主构成威胁。”。

;

;乔丹的支持者说他将成为推进华盛顿保守派优先事项的有效倡导者，民主党控制着白宫和参议院。

;

;“我认为这里的任何人在任何实质性问题上都不必猜测在哪里吉姆·乔丹将起立。他不会欺骗。他不会掩饰。他只是直接告诉你，”共和党众议员汤姆·科尔在投票前提名乔丹为议长时说道。

;

;但其他共和党人出于各种原因投票反对他，包括他在税收、支出和灾难援助方面的立场，以及他的支持者的强硬策略。

;

;新 ;如果乔丹没有获​​得支持，除了麦克亨利之外的共和党替代方案也可能出现。潜在候选人包括众议员汤姆·埃默 (Tom Emmer)，他目前是众议院第三号共和党人。

;

;乔丹是前摔跤教练，是前总统的亲密盟友;唐纳德·特朗普;和极右翼众议院自由核心小组的创始人。

;

;与前任众议院领导人通过筹集资金和建立广泛的联盟来获得影响力，乔丹已成为党内极右翼的直言不讳的领导人，与民主党和共和党都纠缠不休。

;

;他帮助共和党人博纳进入了白宫。 2015 年退休，并主张在 2013 年和 2018 年关闭政府。

;

;国会调查发现，乔丹是特朗普推翻 2020 年大选失败努力的“重要参与者”。

;

;作为众议院司法委员会主席，他领导了对民主党总统乔·拜登政府的调查，并且是对拜登进行弹劾调查的推动者，民主党称该调查毫无根据。

;

;随着前总统唐纳德·特朗普在共和党提名竞选中领先，拜登在民主党初选中的强势地位可能会重演 2020 年总统选举之战。

;< p>;以前参加民主党竞选的小罗伯特·F·肯尼迪现在将成为一名独立候选人，可能;夺走拜登和特朗普的选票;。

;

;80 岁的拜登已经是美国有史以来最年长的总统，他必须说服选民们担心，他有能力再执政四年，;担心他的任期年龄;和糟糕的支持率。拜登的盟友;表示他相信;他是唯一能够击败特朗普的民主党候选人。

;

;在;宣布参选; 拜登宣称捍卫美国民主是他的职责，并提到了2021年1月6日特朗普支持者对美国国会大厦的致命袭击。副总统卡马拉·哈里斯再次成为他的竞选搭档。

;

;经济将成为他连任竞选的因素。尽管美国摆脱了预期的衰退，并且增长速度快于经济学家的预期，但通胀在 2022 年触及 40 年来的高点，食品和天然气的成本;权衡选民;。

;

;拜登领导了西方政府对俄罗斯入侵美国的反应乌克兰正在说服盟友制裁俄罗斯并支持基辅，他的政府正在中东努力防止更广泛的战争。在国内，他推动了大规模的经济刺激和基础设施支出计划，以提振美国;工业产出;，尽管后者几乎没有得到选民的认可。

;

;拜登对移民政策的处理被共和党和民主党批评为美墨边境的移民过境点;在他执政期间创下历史新高;。

;< p>;71 岁的畅销书作家兼自助大师玛丽安·威廉姆森 (Marianne Williamson) 在 ;“正义与爱。”;

;

;以色列军队;巴勒斯坦官员称，在针对周二加沙医院爆炸事件的广泛抗议活动中，两名巴勒斯坦青少年在约旦河西岸拉马拉附近被枪杀。

;

;在黎巴嫩，黎巴嫩广播公司 al-Jadeed 的镜头显示，贝鲁特以北美国大使馆附近的抗议活动演变成暴力活动，安全部队向投掷弹丸的抗议者发射了催泪瓦斯和水枪。

;

;“美国是魔鬼，真正的魔鬼，因为它支持以色列，然后全世界都盲目了。你没看到昨天发生了什么吗？”黎巴嫩示威者穆罕默德·塔赫尔说道。

;

;巴勒斯坦官员将周二被围困地区的爆炸归咎于以色列的空袭。以色列表示，爆炸是由以色列火箭发射失败造成的。巴勒斯坦伊斯兰圣战武装组织否认受到指责。

;

;自控制加沙地带的哈马斯于 10 月 10 日对以色列南部社区进行跨境袭击以来，流血事件激怒了陷入危机的地区。 7 日，1,400 人被杀，人质被劫持。加沙卫生当局称，超过 3,000 名巴勒斯坦人在报复性爆炸中丧生。

;

;

;“在这场战争中丧生的巴勒斯坦人的每一滴血，都让犹太复国主义政权（以色列）更接近垮台，”伊朗总统易卜拉欣·莱西在电视讲话中说道。

;

;在安曼，防暴警察击退了数千名计划向戒备森严的以色列大使馆游行的约旦抗议者。警方称，在与焚烧以色列大使馆附近财产的抗议者的冲突中，数名警察受伤。

;

;中午祈祷后，示威者在约旦首都高呼“阿拉伯土地上没有犹太复国主义大使馆”。

;< p>;在突尼斯，抗议者焚烧以色列和美国国旗，并要求驱逐美国和法国大使，因为他们所谓的无条件支持以色列。

;“他们（巴勒斯坦人）没有食物或水，而且“他们遭到轰炸。这是种族灭绝，不是战争。这是犯罪。我们必须找到解决方案，”示威者伊内斯·拉斯韦德说。

;

;在也门，数千人在首都萨那游行。执政的胡塞运动的穆罕默德·阿里·拉玛谴责了他所谓的以色列谎言和仇恨。

;

;“我们将与你们战斗，”他说。

;

;埃及国家电视台播放了抗议者的镜头在开罗的记者集团大楼前举着巴勒斯坦国旗，高喊反以色列口号。

;

;在贝鲁特真主党控制的南部郊区，数千人聚集在一起举行;抗议;，挥舞真主党、巴勒斯坦和黎巴嫩旗帜并高呼“死亡”真主党高级官员哈希姆·萨菲丁 (Hashem Safieddine) 在集会上表示，该组织比以前“强大数千倍”，美国、以色列和“恶意的欧洲人”应该小心。

;

;沙特阿拉伯以黎巴嫩南部的“时事”为由，敦促其国民离开黎巴嫩，真主党一直在黎巴嫩南部边境与以色列军队交火。

;

;法国外交部周三表示，正在建议鉴于安全局势，尤其是黎巴嫩南部与以色列的边境，法国公民反对任何前往黎巴嫩的旅行。

;

;法国此举之际，欧洲大部分地区与以色列-哈马斯冲突相关的安全担忧加剧。以及伊斯兰国（IS）等其他伊斯兰组织的袭击。法国称，哈马斯 10 月 7 日对以色列发动的袭击造成 1,400 人死亡，其中包括 24 名法国公民。

;

;周三，法国八个机场面临安全警报，其中几个机场被疏散接受检查。凡尔赛宫因五天内第三次安全恐慌而再次关闭。

;

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 23:55:03 +0800 Russian lawmakers vote to scrap ratification of nuclear test ban treatyhttps://reuters.com/article/nuclear-russia/russian-lawmakers-vote-to-scrap-ratification-of-nuclear-test-ban-treaty-idUSKBN31I0X5
;;2023-10-18T15:38:31Z;
;;
;;Members of Russia's State Duma lower house of parliament attend a plenary session in Moscow, Russia, October 17, 2023. Russian State Duma/Handout via REUTERS;
;

;Russia's parliament moved swiftly to fulfil the wish of President Vladimir Putin by completing the passage of a bill that shifts Moscow's legal stance on nuclear testing at a time of acute tension with the West.

;

;The lower house, the State Duma, on Wednesday passed the second and third readings of a bill that revokes Russia's ratification of the ;Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty; (CTBT). Both were passed unanimously by 415 votes to zero.

;

;Putin urged the Duma on Oct. 5 to make the change in order to "mirror" the position of the United States, which has signed but never ratified the 1996 treaty.

;

;Russia says it will not resume nuclear testing unless Washington does, but arms control experts are concerned it may be inching towards a test that the West would perceive as a threatening escalation in the context of the Ukraine war.

;

;Ukraine said Russia was stepping up "nuclear blackmail".

;

;In a statement, its foreign ministry said: "Ukraine condemns Russia's steps to withdraw ratification of the treaty and calls on the international community to respond accordingly to Moscow's provocations aimed at harming the object and purpose of the CTBT."

;

;Since he invaded Ukraine last year, Putin has repeatedly reminded the West of Russia's nuclear might. On Wednesday state TV showed ;rare footage; of him during a visit to Beijing being accompanied by naval officers carrying the so-called nuclear briefcase that can be used to order a nuclear strike.

;

;Russian parliamentary speaker Vyacheslav Volodin said the treaty move was a justified response to Washington's "cheating and cynicism" and its longstanding failure to ratify the pact.

;

;"We understand our responsibility to our citizens, we are protecting our country. What is happening in the world today is the exclusive fault of the United States," he said.

;

;Russia originally ratified the CTBT in 2000. While it is revoking that step, it has so far said it will remain a signatory to the treaty and keep supplying data to the global monitoring system which alerts the world to any nuclear test.

;

;But in introducing the bill on Tuesday, Volodin raised the possibility Moscow might withdraw altogether, and said it would keep Washington guessing about its intentions.

;

;"And what we will do next - whether we remain a party to the treaty or not, we will not tell them," he said.

;

;The law will now go to the upper house, and to Putin for signing.

;

;Putin said earlier this month he was aware of calls for Russia to resume nuclear testing but was not ready to say whether Moscow should do so or not.

;

;Back in February, he said Russia must "make everything ready" to conduct a test in case Washington did so. Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu visited Russia's testing ground in the remote northern archipelago of Novaya Zemlya in August.

;

;CNN published satellite images last month showing Russia, the United States and China have all built new facilities at their nuclear test sites in recent years.

;

;Russia's shift on the CTBT follows its suspension earlier this year of New START, the last remaining bilateral nuclear treaty with the United States, which limits the number of strategic warheads each side can deploy.

;

;Experts at the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute said both steps may be intended by Putin "to generate alarm and uncertainty among states supporting Ukraine in its defence against Russia's illegal invasion".

;

;They said the CTBT move "weakens international stability and diminishes humanity's prospects of avoiding a new nuclear arms race".

;

;But they added: "In this instance, it is difficult for the United States to go far in criticizing Putin's announcement and Russia's potential withdrawal from the CTBT since the USA has itself failed to ratify the treaty and become a party to it in the 27 years since first signing."

;

;Post-Soviet Russia has never carried out a nuclear test. The Soviet Union last tested in 1990 and the United States in 1992.

;

;Arms control experts are concerned that a test by either Russia or the United States could prompt the other to do the same, and China, India and Pakistan might then follow, triggering a new global arms race. All are currently observing test moratoriums, and only North Korea has conducted a test involving a nuclear explosion this century.

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 23:55:03 +0800 What“s next in the US House of Representatives speaker“s race?https://reuters.com/article/usa-congress-speaker-succession/factbox-whats-next-in-the-us-house-of-representatives-speakers-race-idUSKBN31B0W5
;;2023-10-18T15:44:21Z;
;

;The US House of Representatives on Wednesday was set for its second vote on a new speaker, a day after hardline Republican Jim Jordan failed in his first bid for the gavel.

;

;Here are a few next options lawmakers are considering in their 16th day without a leader: JIM JORDAN

;

;Jordan, one of the most prominent members of the Republican right flank, is expected to be nominated again by Republicans to serve as speaker after winning just 200 votes on Tuesday, less than the 217 he needed, after 20 Republicans voted against him.

;

;As chair of the House Judiciary Committee, Jordan is a driving force in the impeachment investigation of Democratic President Joe Biden and has tormented his administration with other probes as well.

;

;Since he was first elected in 2006, the Ohio lawmaker has clashed with past Republican House leaders as a founder of the hardline House Freedom Caucus and helped amplify Republican former President Donald Trump's baseless claims of election fraud. Trump has endorsed his speaker's bid. PATRICK MCHENRY

;

;Republican Representative Patrick McHenry of North Carolina was named to serve as speaker temporarily following Kevin McCarthy's ouster. Some Republicans have suggested he could stay on in the job if they cannot elect Jordan, and the Democrats have said they would be open to empowering the acting speaker.

;

;Two former Republican speakers, Newt Gingrich and John Boehner, have both publicly said that he should continue to stay in the job. STEVE SCALISE The Louisiana lawmaker currently serves as the No. 2 House Republican and was widely seen as ousted Speaker McCarthy's heir apparent. He was nominated as speaker last week but withdrew after he was unable to unify Republicans -- a development some of his colleagues blamed on Jordan.

;

;Scalise was severely wounded in a shooting during practice for a charity baseball game in 2017. He faced questions about his health, as he has been in treatment for multiple myeloma, a form of blood cancer, since August.

;

;Scalise received seven votes on Tuesday, a distant second to Jordan.

;

;KEVIN MCCARTHY The former speaker, McCarthy, has sent conflicting signals on whether he would seek a return, should other candidates lose a speaker vote. McCarthy netted six votes during Tuesday's vote. TOM EMMER

;

;Republican Representative Tom Emmer of Minnesota currently serves as his party's chief vote counter and No. 3 leader overall. He has been floated as a possible candidate should Jordan fall short, and received one vote during Tuesday's vote. TOM COLE Powerful Rules Committee chair Tom Cole has served since 2003, representing Oklahoma as one of only five Native Americans in Congress. He is widely considered a steady hand at the wheel and could gain support from Democrats if nominated.

;

;However, he has repeatedly tamped down talk of putting his name forward, though he received one vote on Tuesday.

;

;Lee Zeldin, a former four-term representative from New York who resigned to make a run for governor of that state, netted three votes during Tuesday's session.

;

;Though the House speaker has always been drawn from the ranks of that chamber, the Constitution does not specify that the speaker must be a lawmaker.

;

;Thomas Massie is a libertarian lawmaker who has been in Congress since 2012, where he represents a district in Kentucky. Massie received one vote on Tuesday, but said publicly that he had told the lawmaker who voted for him to back Jordan.

;

;Mike Garcia is a Navy veteran and a two-term congressman from California who serves on several important committees, including the appropriations and intelligence panels. He received one vote on Tuesday.

;

;Kevin Hern is chairman of the Republican Study Committee, a group of conservative Republicans. He told reporters that he was considering a speaker bid last week, but later abandoned it. Still, his name has come up as a possible Jordan alternative since then. HAKEEM JEFFRIES

;

;Democrats are expected to vote unanimously for their leader, Hakeem Jeffries, though, as the minority party in a chamber controlled 221-212 by Republicans, they do not have enough votes to elect him speaker.

;

;The New Yorker has said he is open to a bipartisan compromise if Republicans cannot muster enough votes on their own to elect Jordan or another one of their members. However, it is exceedingly unlikely that such a compromise would result in Jeffries becoming speaker.
